I'm not sure if I should bring them to my Oncologist appointment when he tells me my actual diagnosis. Thoughts?

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2015 02:38PM Prettyblueyes wrote: Hi Elaine!!! Oh man! I actually did ok in that thing! My arms were aching pretty bad afterwards but for being claustrophobic, I was quit calm. I just kept my eyes closed the whole time and took big deep breathsüòÅüòéüëçüí™ Yesterday was TORCHER I tell ya! I was checking my online file ALL day and finally around 8 it popped up! I jumped off the couch n read it out loud to DH. Most of it I just don't get. Why can't they tell what it is after ALL these scans?! My heart dropped when I read about the liver lesions. I'm not really a heavy or regular drinker for that matter or smoker or any kind of drug user. Soo now I'm obsessed with trying to find anyone with a similar reading/ diagnosis. I'm happy to hear you made it through yours too üòä fingers crossed for good results for you. I feel it's going to be a long weekend for us. Hugs n positive healing thoughts. ~ Joseann

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2015 11:40AM Prettyblueyes wrote: Hello Resilient74! Thank you for replying. Our stories sound familiar. It's all so confusing. I keep trying to read my " Patient file" but all the lingo is baffling! My friend is a nurse and she is going to come over Monday to help me read them which is great because I have my MRI tomorrow and I'm hoping the results will be posted! Then I go the 13th for PET/CT and the 17th, my 42nd Birthday, for my biopsy and the 18th I get to meet the Oncologist and get my results! Eeek!!! I'm so happy that you get to keep your breast. I too can handle losing my hair! My 15 year old wants me to get a Mohawk and dye it before I lose it! Ha! Ha!! Hugs to you ~ Joseanna
Posts.Title: 41 and just had a baby waiting for confirmation Prettyblueyes KSkier

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2015 04:05PM Prettyblueyes wrote: Hello everyone!!! Thank you all so much for all of your encouragement. I've tried to stay away from the boards because I've just been obsessing over every cough and ach n pain I'm feeling!üòùüòÅ But alas I've missed you all and I'm back!  I was supposed to have my PET/CT last week and had been eating my low carb diet and resting and drinking my water for 2 days and then the night before I get a call and the darn Technicians were BOTH out sick! Ohhh I was so frustrated! But my Dr. Got on it and got me rescheduled for this Thursday! I did have my MRI Saturday. They only let females do the breast so she only comes in on Saturdays. It went surprisingly smooth! I didn't get sick, although laying on my stomach was a bit uncomfortable and I had to take some deep breathes, I made it!!! Yippee üòÅüòé So now I have my PET scan Thursday, biopsy Monday and Oncologist Tuesday with my results/diagnosis. My hubby is taking my step son to scout camp from Thurday-Sunday and his parents are coming out this weekend to be there for us during my Birthday, Monday, and my diagnosis. So I'll be super busy cleaning house and maybe doing some yard work. Ohh we went shopping g and I've started collecting HATS! Dr said he's pretty sure I'll be doing chemo so I'm getting a head start on my newest accessory!! Ha! Ha!! Hugs, strength and positive thought to you all. ~ Joseanna
Posts.Title: 41 and just had a baby waiting for confirmation Prettyblueyes KSkier

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2015 09:30AM Prettyblueyes wrote: Hi Elaine, Thank you. Its day 1 of my low carb and I'm dying! Lol!! Why is it when we can't have something it's ALL we can think about?! I'm sitting here stalking my " patient records" to see when they post my MRI results. The Technician that did the scan said it should be posted today. I'm not sure even what it will say or if I'll even understand if it's bad news or not. I'm sorry you have to go back in for another scan. Sounds a little scary. I'll be thinking positive/calming thoughts for you. ~ Joseanna
Posts.Title: 41 and just had a baby waiting for confirmation Prettyblueyes KSkier

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2015 11:56AM Prettyblueyes wrote: Hi Sbeddows! I swear I just read my own post as I was reading yours. So far my Ultrasound, mammagram and MRI are showing a 4.7 cm large mass on my right breast. I also have suspicious nodes in my axillary and a swollen node on my collarbone and 2 very large swollen nodes on my neck that shoot pain up the back of my skull. My right shoulder has been numb now for a couple of months. My MRI showed lesions on my liver and so I'm over here freaking out about Mets too. I had my PET scan yesterday and biopsy Monday, my 42nd Birthday. Then we meet the oncologist the 18th for my diagnosis. It's going to be a VERY long weekend. Ohhh and I too have kids! A 10 week old, 14, 13&7 year olds. I have no BC history though in my family. ~Joseanna
Posts.Title: Just scared like everyone else :( sbeddows SlowDeepBreaths

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2015 10:58PM Prettyblueyes wrote: Hi all! I haven't posted much since my diagnosis in August. I just finished round 4 of my A/C cocktail and I have my 1st PET scan in the morning. TBH, I'm freaking out!!! I'm so scared the chemo didn't do anything and I'm only going to have a few weeks left. Ugh I hate this. I have an appointment with my oncologist on Wednesday for the results. It's going to feel like an eternity.
